Most Illustrious Sir

Despite what was ordered to you by the circular dated yesterday, addressed to all police chiefs, I must add that your orders on the matter must be decisive, exerting all energy against those who, without just cause, do not wish to respond to the call of the Fatherland in the present crisis, making them accountable to the government for the negligence and weakness with which they conduct themselves, and sending the most negligent in carrying out their orders, arrested, to this capital.

God preserve Your Lordship  
Secretary of the Affairs of War and Navy in Caçapava, December 20, 1839.  
Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Chief of Police of the Department of Boqueirão.  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Official letter from the Most Excellent Minister of War dated December 20, received on the 27th of the same month.  
Secretariat of the Presidency of the Republic

Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Chief of Police of the Department of Boqueirão.  
From the Ministry of War.
